subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Need common abbreviation list
msgSnippet: ... I had played with the idea of creating an italic face for Thoth, but with everything else I m doing right now, I don t know if or when I ll get to it.
messageBody:
Ted Larson Freeman wrote:
>
>
> Junior. I'm going to deemphasize connections between letters beyond a
> small number of ligatures. There are several things I want from a new
> font: regular, bold, italic, bold italic; both serif and sans serif
> typefaces, etc. A strong desire to change the keyboard mapping was one
> of the original motivators for me, actually.
>
> I like the examples for Shavian from Kingsley Read that are in the
> document Moira recently uploaded. (Thanks, Moira!) Right now I'm
> reading "Designing Type" by Karen Cheng, sketching ideas by hand, and
> fiddling around with FontForge a bit. I'm a scientist, not an artist,
> so don't expect anything of beauty any time soon.
>

I had played with the idea of creating an italic face for Thoth, but
with everything else I'm doing right now, I don't know if or when I'll
get to it. Thoth works well with kerning, but without kerning some of
the spacing between letters appears too little or to great. So I would
also like to design a mono space font. How exactly are you going to
create serifs with QS? I had thought of serifs myself.

As you may know, I have a site on sourceforge. You are free to use any
of the material I have already created, including the graphics or the
fonts themselves. I can also add you on as a developer. It is much
easier to develop something like a font on sourceforge.

Paul
